identificationModule.briefTitle: Extension Study to Evaluate the Long-Term Outcomes of Pediatric Patients Who Received Treatment for Retinopathy of Prematurity in the VGFTe-ROP-1920 Study (Acronym: Butterfleye Next)
identificationModule.officialTitle: An Extension Study to Evaluate the Long-Term Outcomes of Patients Who Received Treatment for Retinopathy of Prematurity in the VGFTe-ROP-1920 Study

descriptionModule.briefSummary:
Primary objectives of the study are:

* To evaluate binocular visual acuity at the end of this study in patients included from the VGFTe-ROP-1920 study, for treatment of Retinopathy of Prematurity (ROP).
* To evaluate long-term safety outcomes in patients included from the VGFTe-ROP-1920 study, for treatment of ROP.

Secondary objectives of the study are:

* To describe visual function in patients included from the VGFTe-ROP-1920 study, for treatment of ROP.
* To describe overall development in patients included from the VGFTe-ROP-1920 study, for treatment of ROP.

armGroups.label: ROP patients from VGFTe-ROP-1920
armGroups.description: Retinopathy of prematurity (ROP) who were treated with aflibercept and/or laser photocoagulation in study VGFTe-ROP-1920.

interventions.name: Non-Interventional
interventions.description: No study treatment will be administered in this study

primaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of Patients with Adverse Events
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Up to 5 years of chronological age

primaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of Patients with Serious Adverse Events
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Up to 5 years of chronological age

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of patients developing unfavorable ocular structural outcome
secondaryOutcomes.description: Unfavorable ocular structural outcome: retinal detachment, macular dragging, macular fold, retrolental opacity
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 3 years of chronological age, 5 years of chronological age
3 year of chronological age, 5 years of chronological age

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Refractive spherical equivalent in each eye
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 3 years of chronological age, 5 years of chronological age

secondaryOutcomes.description: The Bayley Scales of Infant and Toddler Development, Third Edition (BSID-III) is a standard series of tests that will assess the development of children in 3 areas: cognition, language, and motor skills. This is a mandatory assessment to be performed at 2 years of age.

The Wechsler Preschool and Primary Scale of Intelligence, Fourth Edition (WPPSI-IV) is designed to assess development of older children and is recommended to be performed at 3, 4 and 5 years of age. The assessment at 5 years of age is mandatory. In cases where the WPSSI-IV cannot be used, the Differential Ability Scales II (DAS-II) may be used as an alternative.

The Vineland Adaptive Behavior Scales, Second Edition (VABS-II) Expanded Interview will be included, which includes 4 areas: Communication, Daily Living skills, Socialization and Motor Skills. The assessments at 2 years and 5 years of age are mandatory.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 2 years of chronological age, 5 years of chronological age

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of patients with recurrence of ROP
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 3 years of chronological age, 5 years of chronological age

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of patients requiring treatment for ROP

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

1. Patient was treated in study VGFTe-ROP-1920
2. Age \<13 months of chronological age
3. Signed informed consent from parent(s)/legal guardian(s), which includes compliance with the requirements and restrictions listed in the informed consent form (ICF) and in this protocol

Exclusion Criteria:

1\. Patient has a condition preventing participation in the study, or performance of study procedures

NOTE: Other Inclusion/Exclusion criteria may apply
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: All patients who were treated in the VGFTe-ROP-1920 study are eligible for enrollment into this follow-up study.

ipdSharingStatementModule.description: All Individual Patient Data (IPD) that underlie publicly available results will be considered for sharing
ipdSharingStatementModule.timeFrame:
When Regeneron has:

* received marketing authorization from major health authorities (e.g., FDA, European Medicines Agency (EMA), Pharmaceuticals and Medical Devices Agency (PMDA), etc.) for the product and indication or has globally discontinued development of the product for all indications on or after April 2020 and has no plans for future development
* made the study results publicly available (e.g., scientific publication, scientific conference, clinical trial registry)
* the legal authority to share the data, and
* ensured the ability to protect participant privacy
ipdSharingStatementModule.accessCriteria: Qualified researchers can submit a proposal for access to individual patient or aggregate level data from a Regeneron-sponsored clinical trial through Vivli. Regeneron's Independent Research Request Evaluation Criteria can be found at: https://www.regeneron.com/sites/default/files/Regeneron-External-Data-Sharing-Policy-and-Independent-Research-Request-Evaluation-Criteria.pdf
